page.title: 12Helsthorpe Farm, Crafton
page.content: {Helsthorpe Farm, }mentioned in the original Domesday Book, consists of buildings dating from at least 1750, apart from the new storage barns for grain. It is an arable farm with some cattle, housed during the winter at { {Crafton Farm. }The{windpump}at this farm is still operational but not in use. It was recently bought by the curators of a museum at Chalfont St. Peter where it will be installed as a working model in the near future. A{ {water pump}from the dairy at Helsthorpe Farm is now installed at a similar museum at Pitstone, nearby. The owners of{Honeysuckle Lodge,}a recently improved and extended group of buildings, completely walled, both work in Mentmore. They are licensed to keep falcons and the falconry is sizeable and noteworthy for the rarity of some of the species.
